comments.body: Can we mention the name of the each parameter in doc? ex: datacenter: {{dc1}}, cluster: {{ccr1}}.

My inclination is to just link to the role vars in the repo, and not duplicate them here as there would be a risk of them getting out of sync if we update the role. What do you think @goneri?  I don't think the vars will change often, but at the same time the less often we touch them we might forget that we also need to update these docs.

I don't have a strong opinion on this. The variable names are a bit confusing IMO (e.g: `ccs1` should  be `cluster1`), this for historical reason. I would prefer to fix that before.

In the meantime, I suggest we just point the user to https://github.com/ansible/ansible/tree/602aded6ecfdb20197bc6cfbc7b08ca01f5a7814/test/integration/targets/prepare_vmware_tests/vars

update: The `setup_*` variables should also be documented.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +198,202 @@      setup_datacenter: true

This will give you a ready to use cluster, datacenter, datastores, folder, switch, dvswitch, ESXi hosts, and VMs.

No need to create too much resources
